lexUnit.name: jaw.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: each of the upper and lower bony structures in vertebrates forming the framework of the mouth and containing the teeth.

sentence.text: Why put my head into the bear 's jaws before I have to ?
The chimpanzee extracts the stem with the termites conveniently attached by their jaws , and then pulls it either through its mouth or hand to remove them .
Clare , who felt dizzy and tearful , wondered whether she would ever again be able to move her jaw , which had received a painful blow , probably from the broomstick of her own banner .
He grew dirtier than ever and often would not shave for three or four days together , till his jaw looked coated or grown over with yellow fungus or sprayed like a car with glistening tangerine .
Terence came close to being stroppy until Mallachy got to his feet and squared his iron jaw , but the incident was enveloped by a late surge to the bar .

The brown hairless face with its flat nose , projecting jaws and large teeth revealed in a friendly smile , is decidedly more human than apelike , though there are definite resemblances to the chimpanzee .
Isa was trying to retrieve her jaw from the counter when the door opened and two Americans walked in .
Extending one finger to trace a line down Ace 's jaw to her jugular , Carrefour felt a trembling of excitement at the prospect of ending this one 's life .
A share for everybody would mean less than half a mouthful and if " everybody " meant natives as well , the amount you received would hardly be worth opening your jaws for .
That tightened Mala 's back muscles -- and mine too , though I was more concerned with keeping my jaw from falling open .
When these hatch , the young ants serve their captors , collecting food and feeding it to them , for the slave-makers have such large jaws that they can not feed themselves .
Most , like their predecessors , were armoured in some way , with heavy scales attached to bony plates in the skin , and they had fearsome teeth in their jaws .
We 've had our jaws frozen with anaesthetic to mimic the effect of having a tooth out .
